SubTopics: Explain the founding and development of the Massachusetts Bay Colony.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.
:box:Theocracy – A system of government in which religion provides the basis for government authority.
Based on the source, which statement BEST supports the idea that the Massachusetts Bay Colony was a theocracy?

A.Choice: Anne Hutchinson was banished from the colony for believing in salvation by human effort.

B.Choice: Thomas Hooker often gave sermons instructing people how to act.

C.Choice: Roger Williams left the colony to form a new settlement that practiced religious tolerance.

D.Choice: John Winthrop consulted Puritan ministers before making political decisions.

SubTopics: Describe the significance of the First Great Awakening.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:box:Amendment I

(1) Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; (2) or abridging [limiting] the freedom of speech, (3) or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and (4) to petition the Government for redress [correction] of grievances.
Which section of the 1st Amendment did the leaders of the First Great Awakening MOST influence?

SubTopics: Identify the conditions of enslavement, and explain how slaves adapted to and resisted bondage in their daily lives, including Nat Turner's revolt.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:box:_______________

• Worked slower
• Pretended to be sick
• Broke tools
• Disrupted production
What is the BEST title for this source?

A.Choice: Tactics Used by Labor Unions during a Strike

B.Choice: Ways Laborers Fought against Child Labor

C.Choice: Ways Laborers Fought against Child Labor

D.Choice: Methods Used by Slaves to Resist Slavery

SubTopics: Explain the arguments presented by Stephen Douglas and Abraham Lincoln on slavery in the Illinois Senate race debates of 1858.
Content: Read the source and answer the question.

:box:In my opinion, it will not cease, until a crisis shall have been reached, and passed — “A house divided against itself cannot stand.” ... I do not expect the Union to be dissolved — I do not expect the house to fall — but I do expect it will cease to be divided. It will become all one thing, or all the other.

	— Abraham Lincoln, 1858
Which issue did Lincoln claim was dividing the Union?

SubTopics: Analyze the Dred Scott v. Sandford decision and the resulting split between the North and South.
Content: Which TWO statements analyze how the Dred Scott decision increased sectional tension in the United States?

A.Choice: It declared African Americans were not entitled to the rights of citizenship.

B.Choice: It stated slaves were allowed to sue their slaveholders in federal courts.

C.Choice: It declared the federal government did not have the power to prohibit slavery in the territories.

D.Choice: It stated the rights of citizenship could not be extended to individuals born outside the country.

E.Choice: It declared slavery to be unconstitutional in all territories.

SubTopics: Explain the restrictions placed on the rights and opportunities of freedmen.
Content: Which statement BEST describes an effect of the Freedmen's Bureau on the South?

A.Choice: Fewer African Americans voted in upcoming elections.

B.Choice: State governments expanded the use of Jim Crow laws.

C.Choice: Fewer African Americans attended public schools.

D.Choice: Local businesses closed because of the lack of skilled workers.

SubTopics: Analyze the reasons for and outcomes of groups moving west.
Content: Which statement BEST analyzes reasons why a majority of people traveled along the Oregon Trail?

A.Choice: People sought new opportunities for wealth and adventure.

B.Choice: American Indians wanted to escape reservations and find new hunting grounds.

C.Choice: Businesses wanted to expand trade and build railroads to transport goods.

D.Choice: People wanted to start religious communities to convert American Indians.
